title: Elon Musk, Hollywood Actors Criticize California’s Plan to Cut Solar Subsidies
sub_head: State’s public utilities commission says proposal balances power grid, environment and consumers’ needs; critics say it hampers environmental progress
body:
A proposal to cut incentives for rooftop solar power in California has drawn criticism from some environmentalists, Hollywood stars and business leaders, including Tesla Inc. Chief Executive Elon Musk.
The proposal by the California Public Utilities Commission would add monthly fees for solar customers while also reducing payments to customers for any extra power they generate and supply to the grid, which is known as net metering.
